properties.areaDesc: Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet; Elbert/Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above  6000 Feet/Gilpin/Clear Creek/Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 10 at 5:05PM MST until February 11 at 2:00AM MST by NWS Denver CO
properties.description:
...SNOW AND SLIPPERY ROADS TONIGHT...

.Snow will increase through this evening and is expected to
accumulate on the roadways. Roads will get snowpacked and slick in
spots, especially over bridges and overpasses.  The snow will
start to decrease from north to south after midnight.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10
inches.

* WHERE...The Southern Front Range Foothills, The Northern Front
Range Foothills and Castle Rock.

* WHEN...Until 2 AM MST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the evening commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM MST TUESDAY
